titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 732: Commentaries on canon law

notesStmt.note: Incipit, text (f. 1r): Johannes episcopis, servus servorum Dei dilectis filiis doctoribus et scolaribus [universis Avinione?] commorantibus salutem...
Explicit, commentary (f. 46v): Explicit apparatus Domini Johannis Andree super Clementinis. Deo gratias. Amen.

msItem.title: Constitutiones Clementis V with glossa ord. of Johannes Andreae, f. 1r
Commentary on the Regulae iuris, f. 49v

supportDesc.extent: 63 leaves : 386 x 265 (339 x 240) mm. bound to 298 x 271 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, ii (modern paper) + 63 + ii (modern paper); [1-63]; modern foliation in pencil, lower right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns, with commentary framing the text, and additional commentary and notes in margins in other hands.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Main text and commentary written in a Gothic book script, with additional notes and commentary in several different hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Ornamented initials in red and purple with penwork decoration and rubrication throughout; numerous manicules in different styles and marginal drawings of faces.

binding.p: Modern half calf; upper corner of spine detached and stored with manuscript in mylar sleeve.

origin.p: Written in Avignon[?] in the 14th century (Zacour-Hirsch).
